question: How did Tea Cake's friends react when they learned Tea Cake had beaten Janie?
answer: Tea Cake's friends reacted with envy and admiration when they learned he had beaten Janie. Both men and women in the fields talked about it the next day, and it 'aroused a sort of envy' in them. Sop-de-Bottom told Tea Cake he was 'a lucky man' because you could see every place he hit her and Janie didn't fight back. Sop envied Tea Cake for having such a 'tender woman' and expressed that he wished he could whip a woman like Janie, complaining that his own wife would fight back all night and no one could even tell he had hit her. The women admired how Tea Cake pampered Janie afterward, as if the slaps had 'nearly killed her,' and the men admired Janie's helpless devotion to Tea Cake.
quote: Everybody talked about it next day in the fields. It aroused a sort of envy in both men and women. The way he petted and pampered her as if those two or three face slaps had nearly killed her made the women see visions and the helpless way she hung on him made men dream dreams. 'Tea Cake, you sho is a lucky man,' Sop-de-Bottom told him. 'Uh person can see every place you hit her. Ah bet she never raised her hand tuh hit yuh back, neither... Lawd! wouldn't Ah love tuh whip uh tender woman lak Janie!'
